name: Signal (itch) (Neroshi, Mckenon)
description:
Summary

This game is intended to be played by touch typing with your hands on the home row at all times. But for those who have trouble touch typing or use a layout other than qwerty, we have included mouse controls for the puzzle sections just click the tile you would like to move too and for the walking sections, you may use arrow keys instead of WASD.

Credits:

Programing | Game Design

Game Design | Art | Programming

Confused?

NOTE - Only read past this part if you are struggling to figure things out.

Your goal is to reach the end tile which has a little portal on it, to reach it you may have to activate certain buttons at certain times to open up the way to it.

To achieve this you have the power of creating ghostly past selves which will repeat all the actions you took in the past. you may see these blue orbs on the map. These are wisps, which are your little friends. The amount of wisps you have is the number of ghosts you may create.

Pressing space will create a ghost if you have a wisp, Otherwise pressing space will reset the level.

Also, you have a set number of moves per turn. Using up all of your moves will reset the level.
